author: chris2_2_2
content: etherchain used to show block tip+mev found and I don't see it anymore. Is there a website that shows this on one page?

author: alexssd7fp
content: It was wrong 90% of the time btw

author: pietjepuk
content:
It's still right there on beaconcha.in? They just rely on the values reported by the relays themselves, so I doubt it is wrong that often

( for example, https://beaconcha.in/slot/5414391 ->  https://boost-relay.flashbots.net/relay/v1/data/bidtraces/proposer_payload_delivered?slot=5414391 )

author: acid0003
content: nope, not one that is accurate.

author: butta
content: the complete opposite -- the mev overview on etherchain was mostly incorrect and was solely based on internal transactions to the pool

author: butta
content: but etherchain.org will be shutdown soonTM as we move everything over to beaconcha.in and open source it.

author: pietjepuk
content: Ah, then I totally misunderstood <@636289909359116290> 's question. I wasn't aware of Etherchain showing any such data (I guess also prior to the merge?), only of Beaconcha.in doing it post-merge for the MEV-Boost/relay stuff.

author: butta
content: imo, MEV is less wild nowadays, as there are only 2 big block builders and validators can plug in all relays and pick the most profitable
